Package climenuhelper

Class CLIMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • climenuhelper.CLIMenu
  • public class CLIMenu
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that aides in creating a menu and accepting input in the menu.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      CLIMenu​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> values, java.lang.String listMarkerFormat, int startingKeyNum, int step, PrintMenuNowOption... doPrintMenuNow)
      A CLI menu that lets you choose a custom starting value and the step between values.
      CLIMenu​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> values, java.lang.String listMarkerFormat, HasZeroStartOption hasZeroStart, PrintMenuNowOption... doPrintMenuNow)
      The basic CLI menu.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CLIMenu

        public CLIMenu​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> values,
               java.lang.String listMarkerFormat,
               HasZeroStartOption hasZeroStart,
               PrintMenuNowOption... doPrintMenuNow)
        The basic CLI menu. Has no custom numbers.
        Parameters:
        values - The option strings, such as start, settings, exit etc.
        listMarkerFormat - The marker for the number to be next to or surrounded by, e.g. [1].
        hasZeroStart - If the list should start with 0 or 1. True for 0, False for 1.
        doPrintMenuNow - An optional argument on if the menu should be printed straight after it is created. Most likely to only be used with TRUE.

      • CLIMenu

        public CLIMenu​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> values,
               java.lang.String listMarkerFormat,
               int startingKeyNum,
               int step,
               PrintMenuNowOption... doPrintMenuNow)
        A CLI menu that lets you choose a custom starting value and the step between values.
        Parameters:
        values - The option strings, such as start, settings, exit etc.
        listMarkerFormat - The list marker format at the start of the line. Use # to represent the number e.g. [#], #)
        startingKeyNum - The number to start the list at.
        step - The amount to increase between list items. Cannot be 0.
        doPrintMenuNow - An optional argument on if the menu should be printed straight after it is created. Most likely to only be used with TRUE.

    • Method Detail

      • setOptionsAmount

        public final void setOptionsAmount​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> values)
        Sets optionsAmount via the array list of values from the constructor.
        Parameters:
        values - Size of this used to set options amount.

      • printMenu

        public final void printMenu()
        Prints the menu with the keys and values provided to the constructor.

      • rangeCreator

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> rangeCreator​(int startingKeyNum,
                                                           int optionsAmount,
                                                           int step)
        Creates an Integer type array to be used for the menu keys.
        Parameters:
        startingKeyNum - The number to start the range from.
        optionsAmount - The amount of options the range will have.
        step - The gap between each option.
        Returns:
        An Integer type array with all the keys created.
